transcript.title: CANDIDATE FOR SPEAKER
transcript.content:
At a meeting of Liberal Members of the House of Representatives held

tonight, it was unanimously resolved that the Government's nominee

for the position of Speaker would be the Rt Hon Ian Sinclair MP, Member

for New England.

Mr Sinclair is the longest serving member of the House of Representatives.

He had a distinguished ministerial career in past Coalition Governments

and was for five years Leader of the Federal Parliamentary National

Party.

I have no doubt that if endorsed by the Parliament, Mr Sinclair will

be a distinguished Speaker.

3 March 1998
